summary: Witcher style ENB preset for vanilla weathers
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][center][/center][/size][size=6][center]White Orchard ENB[/center][/size]
[center][size=3]by mobiusbelmont﻿[/size][/center]
[size=4]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ [center]﻿﻿ Witcher inspired ENB preset for .319 binary[/center][/size][center]

[/center]

[size=3]Use ENB binary v319 


[/size][size=3]White Orchard ENB can be used with vanilla weathers.  True Storms looks good with this preset.  Use other weather and extorior lighting mods at your own risk as the fog and sky may look weird

All interior lighting mods should be compatible: ENB (ELE lite), Relighting Skyrim, and ELFX Core files.  
-  please use Only one interior lighting mod at a time, they make similar changes and one will overwrite the other

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19933/?]
[/url]Other mods used in screenshots:
Spring Forest Overhaul
Solstheim Genesis
Realistic Water Two
Dark Forests of Skyrim 
Shadow of Morrowind (with edits by me)
Obsidian Mountain Fogs
True Storms
2K textures/Skyrim HD
Veydosebrom
Technicolor Alchemy Overhaul
Realistic Sun and Sunglare for ENB
Better Embers
Lorkan's Vision Night Sky (low saturation version for ENB)




 
Installation

1.Copy the d3d9.dll and enbhost files from [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0266.htm]here[/url] to your Skyrim folder (wrapper version for BINARY .319 or greater)


2.Copy and paste the White Orchard ENB files to your Skyrim folder.  


3. Edit your skyrimprefs.ini and set the following values:
[Display]
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1 
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawLandShadows=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1
iMultiSample=0 
bFXAAEnabled=0 
iMaxAnisotropy=0


Depth of Field and FixParallaxTerrain are disabled by default and can be enabled through the ENB GUI or the enbseries.ini file.  

The enblocal.ini file provided is configured with AutoDetectMemory enabled.  You should configure your own local enblocal.ini file based on your hardware


CONSULT THE STEP GUIDE FOR ENB FOR MORE INFORMATION ON HOW YOU SHOULD CONFIGURE YOUR enbseries and enblocal files for YOUR RIG 

OR

check out [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74427/?]this great guide[/url] for ENB and Skyrim optimization
